meanings.definition: A small disk or knob sewn onto a garment for fastening or decoration.
meanings.sent1: She sewed a shiny button onto her dress.
meanings.sent2: The blue shirt had buttons down the front.
meanings.sent3: Why did the button refuse to hold the fabric together? It was feeling a bit buttoned-up.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a bright button on a dark coat, bringing joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The button sparkled like a tiny star on her jacket.

meanings.definition: A small, usually circular object used to operate a machine or electronic device.
meanings.sent1: Press the button to turn on the light.
meanings.sent2: The remote control has buttons for different functions.
meanings.sent3: Why did the button go to school? To become a smart button!
meanings.sent4: His words were like pushing a button, instantly igniting her anger.
meanings.sent5: The red button glowed in the dark, tempting him to press it.

meanings.sent1: She will button her coat before going outside.
meanings.sent2: He buttoned up his shirt neatly.
meanings.sent3: Why did the coat refuse to button up? It was feeling a bit rebellious.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to button up her heart, keeping her emotions hidden.
meanings.sent5: The sun began to set, signaling the time to button up for the night.

meanings.definition: To be capable of being fastened by a button.
meanings.sent1: The dress buttons easily at the back.
meanings.sent2: The fabric buttons without any trouble.
meanings.sent3: Why did the shirt enjoy being buttoned? It felt secure and snug.
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to button to his, forming an unbreakable bond.
meanings.sent5: The friendship between them was like two pieces of a puzzle that buttoned perfectly together.
